title: Work, Energy and Power - Grade 9
content:
# Work, Energy and Power - Grade 9

## Learning Objectives
By the end of this lesson, students will be able to:
- Understand the fundamental concepts of Work, Power, Mechanical Energy, Energy Conservation
- Apply scientific principles to real-world situations
- Analyze and interpret scientific data related to Work, Energy and Power

## Introduction
This lesson explores Work, Energy and Power, focusing on Work, Power, Mechanical Energy, Energy Conservation. Students will learn through hands-on activities,
demonstrations, and practical applications relevant to Sri Lankan context.

## Main Content
This section covers Work, Power, Mechanical Energy, Energy Conservation. Students will explore each topic through theoretical understanding and practical application.

## Key Concepts
Work, Power, Mechanical Energy

## Activities
1. Laboratory experiment demonstrating W
2. Group discussion on applications in Sri Lanka
3. Problem-solving exercises
4. Real-world case studies

## Assessment
Students will be assessed through practical work, written tests, and project presentations.

## Resources
- Textbook: Science for Grade 9 (Sri Lankan Curriculum)
- Laboratory equipment
- Digital resources and simulations
learning_outcomes: Analyze concepts related to Work, Energy and Power
